description.summary: voice mode overlay and input protocol

protocol.description:
This protocol allows clients to receive voice input events from the compositor. The compositor has full control over the voice mode orb overlay - clients only receive notifications and voice input events.
Apps can register as voice input receivers: 1. Window-specific: Receives events when that window is focused 2. Default receiver: Receives events when no other receiver is focused (controlled by COSMIC_VOICE_DEFAULT_RECEIVER env var)
When voice mode is activated via hotkey: - If a registered receiver window is focused, it gets start/stop/cancel - Otherwise, the default receiver (if any) gets the events
The orb visual indicator shows where voice input is going: - Floating: Default receiver is handling voice input - Attached: A specific window is handling voice input

interface.name: zcosmic_voice_mode_manager_v1
interface.description: This interface allows clients to register as voice input receivers. The compositor controls voice mode; clients receive events.

request.name: register_receiver

description.summary: register as a voice input receiver

request.description:
Register this client as a voice input receiver. The app_id identifies which windows can receive voice input when focused.
If the app_id matches COSMIC_VOICE_DEFAULT_RECEIVER, this client becomes the default receiver for when no other receiver is focused.

interface.name: zcosmic_voice_mode_v1
interface.description: This interface receives voice input events from the compositor. Events are sent based on focus and receiver registration.

enum.name: orb_state
enum.description: The current display state of the orb.

entry.name: attached
entry.summary: orb is attached to a window

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy this receiver and stop receiving voice input events.

event.name: registered
event.description: Sent when registration is complete. Indicates whether this client is the default receiver or a window-specific receiver.

event.name: start
event.description: Sent when voice input has started and this receiver should begin listening/recording. The client should start capturing audio.

event.name: stop
event.description: Sent when voice input has stopped normally (key released). The client should stop recording and process the audio.

event.name: cancel
event.description: Sent when voice input was cancelled (e.g., user switched focus, pressed escape, or another interruption). The client should discard any recorded audio.

event.name: orb_attached

description.summary: orb attached to this receiver's window

event.description: Sent when the orb has visually attached to this receiver's window. Includes the window geometry for reference.

event.name: orb_detached

description.summary: orb detached from this receiver's window

event.description: Sent when the orb has detached from this receiver's window (e.g., focus changed to another receiver or default).
